summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Bruce Barket and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding requests for statements made by inmate Nicholas Tartaglione concerning Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt in July 2019. The prosecution agrees to produce some statements but declines to provide video and reports of the suicide attempt itself, citing relevance and Rule 16.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, making requests to the U.S. Attorney's Office for statements and evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Inmate at MCC who was interviewed regarding Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt; his statements are being requested by his attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate whose reported suicide attempt on July 22-23, 2019, is the subject of the document; statements about the event were conveyed by him to MCC staff.

persons.context: Copied on email correspondence between Bruce Barket and the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the evidence request.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney making requests on behalf of his client Nicholas Tartaglione for statements and evidence.
Both were inmates at MCC; Tartaglione was interviewed about Epstein's reported suicide attempt, and Epstein conveyed statements attributed to Tartaglione to MCC staff.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Reported Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's reported attempted suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), prompting interviews with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: Production of Tartaglione Statements
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office agrees to produce a zip folder with reports of statements made by Nicholas Tartaglione regarding Epstein's suicide attempt.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced reports of statements made by inmate Nicholas Tartaglione regarding Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt in July 2019.
The prosecution declined to provide video and reports of Epstein's suicide attempt itself, stating they were not relevant to the case or covered under Rule 16.
Statements attributed to Tartaglione were conveyed to MCC staff by Jeffrey Epstein himself, indicating communication between the inmates.
The correspondence reveals defense efforts to obtain evidence about Epstein's death while incarcerated.
